page.title: 10SOCIAL CONCERNS:WOODBOROUGH
page.content: In June there was a garden-party at the Old Vicarage for{Age Concern.} The annual Strawberry Fair,for{Meth. {Church funds,}was in the Meth.Church schoolroom on July 10th,price Â£1.00.Other organisations make money at the{Street Market}in July. The continuous appeal in aid of{Cancer {Relief}is well supported. In 1983{Ian Warner}took delivery of a'Pony'electronic buggy,bought by the villagers.Ian is a nine-year-old lad, paralysed below the waist,but presently a pupil in Class 5 at Woodborough School. The Â£8000{Organ Fund}appeal was achieved in March.The new instrument, and a fifth bell,were dedicated in S.Swithun's church,July 8th. 10% the school's{Autumn Fair}total and donations at a choir concert were given to the{Ethiopia Appeal:}Â£100.
